intro: Ecklonea, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Ecklonea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
